Reviews.Title: “Updated 60's Chic”
Reviews.Author: Helena K
Reviews.Content: The Pearl kept all the cool stuff (excellent service, style lines) and added the modern stuff- free internet, flat screen tv, poolside movies and locally sourced gourmet food. Very hip!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the Pearl”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: The Pearl always comes through. This place makes you feel like you are on vacation. Friendly staff, great food and fun bar to hang out at and have a drink. I'll be back, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “If you want something quirky and fun - this is it”
Reviews.Author: Gemsybob
Reviews.Content: This place was a great place for the last night of our holiday. It's a very trendy, quirky and humorous hotel with a good sense of fun about it. For example - each room has its own decorative fish in it! Ours was a deep pink fish called Gilligan, who even had his own spotlight... The decor was very new and cool, and though it wasn't the quietest place to stay (the bar stayed noisy til after 11pm and there were roadworks outside our room), you couldn't beat it for sheer experience. The bar food is gourmet and delicious, and the chef catered really well towards my gluten and dairy free diet. The cocktails are heavenly - best I've had in a long time. The staff are friendly and fun; they'll just stop by your table to chat. And of course the pool (probably the warmest pool we swam in in Cal) has a big screen by it for their Wednesday night Dive-Ins and other events (we were there for a documentary). That's not everything I could say at all - for a relatively small hotel, it packs a lot in. Fantastic way to end our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: nboysen19
Reviews.Content: This property was a cute boutique hotel. I enjoyed the decor of the room, the restaurant had tasy food and the staff were uber friendly. We didn't have any issue parking on the street and our room was directly over the restaurant but we didn't have any issue falling asleep. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “The complete package! A great hotel, wonderful food and an amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Pearl with several of my friends and the place was fabulous! The layout of the hotel was perfect for several people traveling together. It had an intimate feel where everyone was comfortable and at home while offering great food and a fun bar scene for the evenings. The staff went above and beyond in terms of service. I've never stayed somewhere with such a friendly and helpful staff. Thanks to them I had an amazing birthday celebration. They offered awesome recommendations for dinners, were extremely accommodating with random requests and even gave me a beautiful cheese plate on the house when they found out it was my birthday! I would definitely go back and I highly recommend them while staying in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaSunshine
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at the Pearl. After reading most of the reviews on trip advisor being positive, I thought we were going to be staying at a really cool place. The restaurant food was ok. Movie night was cool. Our first night at the hotel was a Thursday night. After the movie we went back to our room. The room smelled good. But, there were many areas which could have used some attention. Dust along the edges of the walls, Nicks in the nice white furniture (would look better if touched up), Bathtub really gross and needing to be replaced (found out the next day that the drain could use attention too....standing water while showering), the caulking along the bathroom floor was so bad and the glaze on the tile was coming off. Under the sink the pipes are rusting out. Just needed much needed repair or replacement. There is a hairdryer, but it is very sticky with hairspray and tons of lint in the vent. The noise from the hotel is awful. The same retro music playing all night long. And a huge gap under the door to the room, which does not help at all! One last thing, the bedding is soiled. I woke up after the first night and was going to pull up the comforter, this is when I saw the stains! Gross!! So, I left a note asking to be replaced. The comforter must have been just turned around, as the stains were still there! I would not stay here again! Staff is super nice and cool, but attention to detail is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine W
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Pearl! Hip, modern architecture, comfortable rooms, very accommodating staff. We were there on movie night and the place was packed; very fun, though no one was in the pool. Good food and drink during the movie! Quiet room, even though the hotel is on a busy street. Lots of amenities within walking distance; cool neighborhood vibe. Close to many San Diego attractions as well. Though we didn't use it, non-car/transit seemed readily available right outside the door. Parking was a little challenging. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but...”
Reviews.Author: Mary_D45
Reviews.Content: I was there for two nights. The room was clean and the staff was friendly enough. The bed was comfortable and everything worked well enough. I was disappointed that you had to go to the bar to get ice and, in the evening, things can get a little loud with the patrons at the bar. Overall, I was satisfied with my accommodations, but I can't say I would stay there again for my next SD getaway. I'm not poo-pooing the place, it just wasn't for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great drinks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lee62694
Reviews.Content: Can't really say anything about the hotel but the drinks at this place are amazing. Very creative cocktails. The bartender had long brown dreaded hair when I visited in January. He took all of his drinks seriously. He would put a straw in and hold out a small taste to make sure each drink was exactly correct. I don't even eat blackberries but his drinks were so intriguing that I tried one of those. I manage bars and restaurants at a hotel and have brought some of those ideas to my staff as well. Very impressive. Love the old sitcoms and movies playing on the tv screens. Great ambiance!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Pearl Stay”
Reviews.Author: PazosArmando
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to revisit and say that things are still superb at The Pearl. New menu in the restaurant is well-executed. Kimberly Parker is doing a smoking job of keeping things up to snuff. Thanks again to Meghan and Marcella @ the front desk for all their invaluable assistance as always! Appreciate all the swell cocktails from Jamie and Emily behind the bar, and great service from Adam, Brian, Paul, Jamie, Sarah Wood and Vanh in the restaurant. Major shout out to the kitchen staff: chef Jaison, Garrett, Johnny, and Nugget (Chris) for some outstanding meals; really looking forward to enjoying Sunday Brunch during my next stay!! A thousand thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Property and Staff were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jill P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pearl for my friend's 40th birthday. It was the highlight of the trip! The property was excellent. Very clean and great decor. There are beta fishes in everyroom and each room is a little different but well maintained and extremely clean. Whoever designed the hotel did a great job. Has a very boutique feel. We ate dinner at the restaurant several times and the food was always fantastic. Kim Parker and the rest of the staff at the hotel gave us superior service and great recommendations around town. Kim even gave us a great lead on a roof top bar that would allow us to celebrate the birthday in style. Kim even gave us sparklers to toast her with. That level of service and detail is not easily found. The hotel is 5 stars all the way. You won't find this level of service and detail anywhere else. We have already started talking about an annual trip to The Pearl Hotel! Cheers, Jill

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl staff was phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: Anton N
Reviews.Content: Very nicely updated classic hotel with a swankiness that reminds one of a down to earth W Hotel. The rooms are smallish but very comfortable keeping it simple with the basics and a beta fish to keep an eye on things. The staff went well beyond the call of duty for our group that included a birthday girl. Picked up our names quickly and had some nice comp's in the form of an incredible cheese plate pool side and other treats by the bar and at dinner. Speaking of which the dinner menu was excellent, short ribs, half chicken and oysters were wonderful. All in all a wonderful experience, many thanks to Kim P, Von, and Emily!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Barbara28970
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on business. At first I thought it would be a great experience-quirky and hip place. I had to give a presentation the next day so I needed a good night's sleep. Unfortunately that did not happen-my room was above the bar and it was HORRIBLE. Very loud. I called downstairs several times but it never got quieter. I complained the next day and asked to be moved to a different room. They gave me a different room but absolutely refused to honor the rate that I had for the original room. And they were very rude about it. i would not stay at this hotel if it were the last hotel on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Basic motel with a great reno”
Reviews.Author: jamie g
Reviews.Content: The Peal has great aesthetic value, really nice modern reno, but the stay was definitely average. Rooms are very basic and the bathrooms/showers could use an update (and had a funny, musty smell.) Not sure if I would agree with their definition of "fine boutique accommodations". The restaurant on the weekend was great - very lively and delicious food. If you're looking for nightlife outside of their own restaurant on the weekends (we were disappointed to find that they close up at 10:30 SHARP weekdays) and don't have a car, not the best location. We booked through Tablet Hotels and the location said La Jolla - well, it's close to, but a 20 minute drive on the freeway. So not much to do at night in the area after 10:30. Also sad that the pool wasn't heated, even on two 28 degree days. Bike rentals were much appreciated - we biked to Ocean Beach (the closest beach) which took about 45 minutes (but the La Jolla beaches were much better). The Pearl staff themselves were pretty apathetic - must be the hip environment. Housekeeping was great. All in all an average stay, after all it's $99/night.

Reviews.Title: “Basic digs a bit above”
Reviews.Author: bealocal
Reviews.Content: This hotel works if you are coming in late and headed out to the airport early. Good value $99 rooms are worth it for a few hours. But if you are used to a higher quality boutique hotel, this place will disappoint for a longer vacation stay. I am 40 and see this more as a 20 something hotel. The hotel is on a VERY busy road and not really walkable to anywhere you may want to go. They have good marketing, it worked on us, but it is not the type of place I would stay at normally, except for the airport reason I listed above. This hotel is nicely decorated, new interiors, and clean. The walls seem thin, there is no in-room safe, pool area is teeny, bed is cheap, hardscape echoes outside the door. I didn't really find the staff overly friendly, but they were fine. Assess your wants and needs before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay at the Pearl "gone great"”
Reviews.Author: Markgus
Reviews.Content: My wife & I are in S.D. every year for business, and have stayed at The Pearl Hotel almost every year since it opened. I've read the other reviews, and agree with hip, retro-modern, cool atmosphere. It really is like staying over at a "cool" friends house. Also, the entire staff was great, working as a team, without the "attitude" so common today at nice places. I worked all day writing while sitting at the bar (its' closed during the day), and accomplished my goals. The food is good (my wife is a "foodie") and we always eat there during our stays. Its just nice when your on the road, and get where your going, to not have to go somewhere else to have a drink, eat, or just chill-out. Its just a great place to be.There is a little road noise, due to its proximity to the street, and the bar crowd can create some noise if you turn in early. We usually ask for a room towards the back that is a little more quite. I guess in summation I would say that if you enjoy the mortuary quite, cookie-cutter corporate hotel style, stay at one of those. They're all the same, and easy to find. If you want to stay at a nice, easy-going fun place, stay at The Pearl. I would recommend The Pearl Hotel to everyone except the up-tight traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a hip, fun friend's house”
Reviews.Author: sara09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Pearl for the weekend with my husband - our third time, and it just gets better! The Pearl is retro-modern hip, but without the attitude. Design is simple, comfortable, inventive, tasteful...and just cool. Arrived late Friday night to a busy bar- this place is happening, which we loved! We had a drink and then went to our room (23), a little worried if it would be loud, and were pleasantly surprised that it was not. Slept like a log in the amazingly comfortable bed. Had a wonderful dinner Saturday night - this place makes the best soups, the best burger and the best beignets ever! But what really sets this place apart is the service, from the front desk, to the bar, to the restaurant...they seem genuinely interested in making sure you have a great, fun stay. Will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: pearlan
Reviews.Content: I loved the pearl.It's a beautiful small hotel.I loved the bar and the pool area the food was great and the room has a nice design, its clean and big.The dive in theatre was a lot of fun and also the bingo night.You never feel alone! I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best Place Ever"”
Reviews.Author: kelly p
Reviews.Content: With out a doudt the best service ever,the friendliest staff so helpful.I really do think it was the bes birthday present ever!!!!!!!!So urban hip,i was always happy to come "home" to see smiling faces and Rambo swimminging in the light.I can't wait to go back that's all i am asking for for my Birthday this year.Just can't express how awesome it was ,great vibe,food,and the dive in was fabulous,hope to return soon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole C
Reviews.Content: My review will be a little different than others as we did not stay at the pearl. My husband and I had booked a room at the pearl for 6 nights, but we had also just been in Vegas for 6 nights so needless to say we had a LOT of luggage etc. when we arrived at the pearl we were greeted by the smell of delicious food, good music, friendly staff and lots of other guests/locals just having a good time! When we arrived at our room we were greeted by a modern sophisticated, environmentally friendly, clean space! However due to the fact that this is a boutique hotel the rooms were too small for us (this time due to the fact we had so much luggage and we had 6 more days of travel) I should mention that although the rooms are small they have made good use of the space! My husband and I decided that it was just not the type of room we needed for this trip. I reluctantly made my way back to the front desk to ask if we could cancel our room and was expecting them to charge us for half of the stay which is the policy at almost every hotel and is also fair....I was happily surprised by an entirely different scenario...the gal at the front desk apologized for the room being to small and offered to move us to their slightly larger room which would have been great but another guest had specially requested that room for a portion of our stay, so instead the gal at the front desk cancelled our reservation, offered to make a new reservation for us at a different hotel and gave us 2 free drinks to use when we return to the pearl for supper (which we will because the food smelled great and the atmosphere was awesome!) In short...although we did not end up staying I wanted my review to show others that you DO NOT come across service like this often...even at 5 star properties...at the pearl they really do put guests first even if it means they lost out on a reservation! For this reason alone when we return to San Diego again (under different circumstances less luggage etc) we will definitely stay at the pearl! Kudos to the staff and management... a lot of hotels could learn a thing or 2 from you about guest service! You are second to none!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat”
Reviews.Author: JD_traveler2000
Reviews.Content: A friendly boutique hotel. Well designed. Urban hip without being pretentious. And VERY affordable. None of the loud chaotic scene and traffic headache of staying downtown but only 10 minutes away... so a great way to be in the heart of SD while keeping a distance from the drunk goofballs and mid west tourists that that flock to downtown on the weekends. We jogged along the harbor for sunset and enjoyed a cocktail at the cool bar in the evening. I like that it is small and feels like friends run it. Very friendly staff. All around, an excellent stay. We were there in Jan so perhaps during the summer, it is a pumping scene but it felt pretty relaxed - which we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent, and hilarious”
Reviews.Author: RitaOC
Reviews.Content: The fish in the light fixture really sold it for us. Wish we'd been there in the summer for dive-in movies. Look, it's not the Hilton, but it was still awesome. We had a great, comfortable, incredibly affordable stay. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Back again . . . and will return on my next visit”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Another great experience at the Pearl Hotel. Love the location, friendly staff, and the fun atmosphere. Arrived very late and departed very early, but still felt very welcome. Love the rooms and amenities. Will definitely be back on my next visit to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashlee E
Reviews.Content: My sister had her wedding here and it was beautiful! The way in which The Pearl was transformed was breathe taking! The Pearl has activities which accommodate all ages; movies by the pool, vintage prom, pumpkin carving, dinner for two or ten, too an energetic bar with incredible drinks. I've been coming to The Pearl for some time now and with it's amazing staff and energetic aura it has yet to let me down!

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Professional, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erik G
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip scheduled for December in San Diego and had decided to come a bit early to enjoy the sights and see some friends before starting the work week. It was rather difficult to find a hotel that could meet per diem rates in San Diego while providing a unique experience to the area. A little digging online and I found The Pearl. I took a chance and booked it for the whole 10 days of my trip. This turned out to be an excellent decision! What a fun place! The hotel is small and parking is limited, but they were extremely generous and hospitable. The hotel has a fantastic bar with about a dozen or so taps of all local crafted beer (no macro stuff on tap here) that was a real pleasure to drink. Their bartender manager has created some really delicious drinks here that at first may raise an eyebrow when reading the description, but will have you ordering another before you know it. Also the hotel does dinner every night, but Sunday. This is not your run of the mill sub-par hotel food either, these dishes are made to impress and they do at that. The presentation, taste, and ingredients are all something you would expect to see on a plate at a fine dining restaurant, but the prices can't be beat by comparison. You can get some exquisite scallops here for a little over twenty bucks. Also they have an appetizer of dates, stuffed with blue cheese and wrapped in bacon that's out of this world. It is a bit decadent, though, so share with a friend. My room was great. There was a Beta fish in a bowl named, Flo, to keep me company throughout the week. My room had a nice walk out patio and sitting area with a table and chairs that provided adequate privacy with walls separating you from the rooms to either side of you and wall of swaying bamboo to shield you from prying eyes from the buildings next door. It was a very relaxing setting. Since I was there on business I sometimes needed to get online with my laptop and I was pleased to find that the Pearl offers Wi-Fi complimentary to the room. And one great thing about that was I didn’t have to deal with terrible internet speeds because it's not some massive chain hotel with hundreds of rooms sharing the same pipeline. This was a huge plus for me. One thing I should note, if you are an early riser you should be aware that there are many people that come to The Pearl simply for the bar and restaurant so the noise level could be a bit much for you if you are a light sleeper and need to go to bed before 11PM (when the bar closes on the weekdays). For me, none of these things were a problem. I found the noise level to be just fine and I was getting up at 6AM every morning. Go here and you will not be disappointed. The drinks are great, the food is great, and the staff is super friendly. They will engage in conversation with you and address you by name. For example, one evening while I was having dinner the chef came out for something and when I saw him I complemented the meal and the great beer on tap. We got to chatting and before long he was pouring tasters of all their stuff on tap and suggesting other great places to go for a drink. I love microbrews and brewpubs so this was all great info. Another night I got to talking with Jaime, the bar manager, who comes up with some really amazing and unique drinks at the hotel. Before long he was experimenting like a mad chemist and we were all trying out new drink prototype samples. If you want a place that is fun, relaxed, and friendly where you can get a great drink, a fantastic meal, and a nice room at a great rate then this is the place to go. I definitely am staying here again the next time I am in San Diego for business (or pleasure!).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Hip”
Reviews.Author: lonewolf M
Reviews.Content: A nice little Gem with great service and comfortable rooms. Jamie is excellent behind the bar, and Megan very helpful at the desk!

Reviews.Title: “Blown away”
Reviews.Author: jamesconnors28
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Pearl was great. It has such a fun, hip and energetic feel with a mid century modern look. Bathrooms are gorgeous. The place has a great vibe and the little touches like the handwritten welcome note from the manager was really a nice touch. A great find and an excellent value minutes from all the well-known San Diego attractions. I will definitely be back and soon!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rjm2090
Reviews.Content: Walked into the room and it was small and sparsely furnished but, I guess there really was no room for a table. The A/C-Heat was the typical in that it had 2 temperatures (arctic and sauna) and nothing in between. The TV was difficult to turn off and on. There was only 1 glass in the entire room. The toilet had to be "jiggled" to stop running. This room was across the hall from a storage room and there seemed to be constant noise all the time. It seemed to be a novel way to turn a run down "motel" into a "boutique" hotel with a few contemporary furnishings that could not disguise the fact that it was an old motel. The tub had numerous gouges in it and you could see daylight threw the door (great insulation). We were charged an extra $10 to park and after returning from going out to dinner all the hotels spots were taken and we had to park 3 blocks away. We checked out and were never asked how our stay was or even thank you for staying with us. Will not be returning or recommending this "hotel" to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: Went there for a holiday company party and from the moment we walked in we were treated poorly. We had to ask for towels and blankets 3-4 times until we actually had them delivered. My bf by accident knocked a lamp over in the middle of the night and they charged us and extra 100 dollars on our credit card. The lamp was maybe worth 30 to 40 at most. Unless they get better staff at this hotel I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kasey A
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a truly great experience for me. The staff is wonderful. The hotel is retro, fun and unique without trying to hard or coming off as overtly pretentious. Hip without the hipster attitude that runs common in most hot SD spots. Simply perfect. I travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels some 5 star, bed and breakfasts and tons of fellow boutique dwellings – this one stood out. Adorable and considered. The staff is what makes the pearl truly shine as they were the most accommodating hotel staff I have ever come across. I came in frazzled, the manager sensed such gave me two (yes, two!!) free drinks, and carried my luggage to my room. Free bike rentals, fun bar, great (creative and locally minded) menu! I will definitely be back and would recommend this little gem to anyone coming to sunny SD. Better for couples and singles without children, grown up vibe and the pool is not heated.

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is Very Cultured...”
Reviews.Author: PAUL M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have done a few staycations at the Pearl and we feel like we have gone back to a simpler time where all of the super hip, mid century furnishings are from our parents era and the bar serves up unique libations that tickle the palate and help to forget about the kids at grandma's house. The kitchen served up tasty meals for dinner and the Sunday Brunch. We loved the mac n' cheese, the mussels, and the amazing scallops with an affordable wine list that complements the meal. Overall, the place has a great vibe, well appointed rooms and lots of things going on to make you come back again and again. We love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories!”
Reviews.Author: Paulshappy
Reviews.Content: The check in at The Pearl was quick and easy during my November 2011 visit, especially since I pre-paid over the internet. The place immediately caught my attention since it’s a mid-century do-over that has a very unique styling and curb-side appeal. My compliments to Meaghan on the front desk...she's very pleasant and a wealth of info for me and other travelers too… an amazing asset for The Pearl! The location is very good as it’s only a $10 buck cab ride from the airport, within walking distance to many local sights, and within walking distance, or a short bus ride, to downtown San Diego. My room (#10) overlooked the pool and was just fine for me; featuring a large low-strung bed on a wooden platform, a double size couch and a chair with wall mounted desk for laptop. The entire room overall, and the bed itself, was clean and crisp, compliments to the cleaning staff! Yes, they do have a ‘fish’ in the room and that’s so cool. The décor is funk and hip and eye-appealing. There are plenty of towels in the bathroom plus spares by the pool. There is also a good quality iron and iron board in the room to keep your shirt crisp. PRO Funky décor, 60’s style for sure, loved the fish, loved the clean linens, loved the area shag carpet, loved the ‘live’ plant, loved the a/c in the wall, loved the ‘touch lamp’ and loved the spiffy wall-mounted desk area for the internet connection, and LOVED the free internet too! Loved the large wall-mount flat screen TV. Loved that the bathroom is done-over okay with a new sink and toilet and dual light switches! Loved the lobby bar and the always entertaining customers; it’s certainly a local attraction, and the restaurant too with such unique local offerings, great food! The pool itself is fine; it’s warm and salted and kept clean...Thank you! And the pool-side heaters were a blessing during the Wednesday night movie. Speaking of movies, the large screen is pretty groovy and one of my main attractions for booking at The Pearl. Truly the best part of The Pearl is that it’s an accepted part of the local community and it’s patroned by the locals; simply put...an excellent atmosphere! CON Didn’t like the fact I couldn’t buy a beer at the hotel bar before 5pm, but I do understand Liquor laws. (There is a liquor store about 50 steps away and they have all the drinks, mixes, and snacks you need, along with great service too!) Didn’t like that there was no fridge in the room, but they did offer to keep my beer in their fridge, loved that! Didn’t like that there was no coffee maker in the room, overseen on my part (I never stay at a place without a coffee machine and fridge, but this was the exemption I guess), but the lack of coffee machine was tempered with the offer of free morning coffee at the lobby bar, and strong coffee too, a great wake-up bonus! RECOMMENDATIONS TO MANAGEMENT: THE ROOMS ARE GOOD OVERALL, COOL AND VERY CLEAN, THANK YOU. BUT DO CHECK OUT SMALL BATHROOM REPAIRS SUCH AS BENT SHOWER RODS, WORN BATHROOM FLOOR TILES, TUBS THAT HAVE THE PORCELAIN WORN OUT(MAYBE TIME FOR LINERS?) ALSO, DON'T FORGET TO REPLENISH THE H2O SPA BATH PRODUCTS ONCE THEY ARE GONE. CONSIDER ALSO PURCHASING NEW RETRO CHAIRS AND TABLES POOLSIDE; THEY ARE OLD AND THE LINEN CHAIRS POOL-SIDE ARE DIRTY AND NOT INVITING TO SIT AROUND AT! IN CLOSING...I WOULD STRONGLY RECOMMEND THE PEARL AS A PLACE TO STAY FOR ANY TRAVELER TO THE SAN DIEGO AREA. IT’S A BREATH OF FRESH AIR, A YOUNG AND INVIGORATING EXPERIENCE AND A UNIQUE CHANGE FROM THE COOKIE CUTTER HOTELS PREVALENT TODAY…SAFE TRAVELS, BE GOOD, WE'LL BE BACK AT THE PEARL SOON...CHEERS!

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough, this well-maintained mid-century motor lodge is a great find in a fabulous city!”
Reviews.Author: Casaolson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Pearl for two nights in September and really enjoyed it! The staff was friendly and genuinely wanted each customer to be comfortable and satisfied. Check-in was easy ... and because it was 8pm, we moved immediately to the bar for a yummy signature cocktail and cheese plate. The bartender was jovial and attentive and the music was great ... love the vibe. Our room (don't remember the number, but our fish was "Willy") was very clean and spacious - a sofa and king-sized bed. The lounge offers delicious coffee in the morning ... we enjoyed it by the pool with free wi-fi. When we forgot an item in our room and didn't realize it until we were back at home, the staff located and sent it to us. Love The Pearl ... we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Vibes”
Reviews.Author: Phillips912
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to do a staycation in our new town and stumbled upon The Pearl through our searches. It was a great find indeed. The decor has a mod, retro, hip vibe... full of earthiness, fun, and intentionality. The staff was extremely open and friendly and quick to offer suggestions about what to see and do around town. The beer and cocktail list is great. I strongly suggest the Marie Antoinette... the hint of lavender in it made it feel fancy. They are definitely helping lead the mixology trend of infusing interesting things together for a delish beverage. The room was great. Had a great radio with their own playlist which helped us stay with the whole vibe. I still miss our little goldfish friend. The only mishap happened at Happy Hour when we weren't told that the beer we ordered wasn't included in the happy hour special... but even that was readily remedied by the owner of The Pearl. If you want a unique boutique hotel, I definitely recommend this place. It's also near to the Sunset Cliffs. We are planning to go catch one of their Wednesday night flicks soon. :)

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl Hotel rocks.”
Reviews.Author: Brokerdude
Reviews.Content: The Pearl Hotel was recommended to me by a friend a while back. So when I needed a place to stay I stayed at The Pearl Hotel. It is super cool with a strong emphasis on the aesthetic while still inviting and fun. The room I stayed in was super clean and comfortable. I only wish my wife was with me On this trip.

Reviews.Title: “nicely renovated, small motel”
Reviews.Author: batianaustin
Reviews.Content: nicely renovated, small motel with pool courtyard used for dining & parties. modern furnished rooms although bathroom was not renovated (and needed it). price was alright but varies a lot relative to day of week. no onsite (or nearby) restaurant for breakfast. free wireless. limited free street parking. main drawback: location in point loma is not convenient for bars/restaurants in central san diego (some 10 min drive away).

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere & service for awesome price”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights!! The bar is AWESOME!! Great drinks and food, sweetest bartender Emily! Great mid century look through out the whole hotel..Tamara was so helpful at the front desk with suggestions for things to do in San Diego. Would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique to a T”
Reviews.Author: RohitF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on a roadtrip with the family. Out of the way location on a motel strip but it does a great job of differentiating itself. Offers the value of a budget boutique with the service and amenities of a more upscale property/ PROS Comfortable, nice-sized rooms (the fish in the room is a great touch) Free wi-fi and music docks etc Great restaurant with friendly service Surprisingly great toiletries for a value hotel CONS Impractical suggestion but an elevator would have been great (especially carrying big bags after a long day) Facility to get hot water to make coffee (had to get down to the reception and came back with a cup of steaming water)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Judith_S_11122
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit of a hotel snob, so I wasn't expecting much from a last-minute booking at an affordably-priced boutique hotel in a less tourist-y part of San Diego. Boy, was I wrong! The Pearl gives you all the extras of an upscale hotel: the super-accommodating staff; the wonderful bar-restaurant, the spacious, comfortable, immaculately clean rooms -- wrapped in an extraordinary package of chic mid-century modern stylishness. It's minutes from downtown San Diego, and just a block from the sport-fishing harbor. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TimBusse
Reviews.Content: The overall hip vibe and the friendly & accomodating Staff at the Pearl are several of the reasons we keep coming back to the Pearl, visit after visit. The rooms are comfortable and visually soothing, the complementary morning coffee is top-notch, and the bar/restaurant is excellent. The Pearl is in a class unto itself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - Unique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FiFi_Travels
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend because we wanted to turn a weekend wedding we were attending into a mini-vacation. I can't begin to tell you how friendly and helpful every staff member was that we encountered within 24 hours. One of the managers (Kimberly Parker) even went as far as to take our picture by the beautiful living wall by the pool - Thank you! The bar manager was awesome and our server, so entertaining! It was 80's night when we ate at the restaurant. The food was delicious - I had the Quinoa Stuffed Pepper dish. We stayed in The Strand room and were super happy with the cleanliness, space, decor, and the private patio. The bathroom was wall to wall tile and had really high ceilings, which is great for us tall people! Parking is $10 per day +$1 that is donated to a charity of their choice and there are not a ton of parking spots. We ended up having to leave a night early because of a sick puppy at home, but we look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: DrLoveParkville
Reviews.Content: After checking in we went to the lounge for a glass of wine. The host refused to sit us at a table we requested. He motioned us to the back of the lounge but we wanted to sit near the pool. Again, I pointed out a table and he said "there are only two of you" and I pointed out that everyone at the other tables totalled only two and further asked if he was capable of counting past two. Why we we discriminated against.? edlderly white couple moderately dressed?? Our room was a 15x15 box with a mattress on the floor posing as a "platform bed", lumpy one side and totally compressed on the other with matching lumpy pillows. Hard and soiled Berbar carpet. A "desk" was bolted to the wall with a set of matching plastic metal leg chairs. The bathroom had vintage cracked tile complete with ants and leaky faucet. Free WiFi; no fridge or microwave. Music and crowd noise on Saturday night continued until 1am. CAUTION: The hot water will scald you. If you have young children, do not let them turn on the water. We notified the management but to no avail. The Pearl is conveniently located within walking distance of 3 liquor stores, tattoo parlor, and a Pyshic palm reader. This hotel is not handicap accessile to the second floor. If you are looking for cheap, well you found it."

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome -”
Reviews.Author: kbjorkman
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night (really would have loved to stay a week!) with the family for a short one day trip to the San Diego Zoo. This is a terrific hotel! The design and vibe go without saying (as awesome) - but the attentive and authentically nice Pearl staff made this place even better! From the front desk agent who knew who I was before even getting to the front desk to the bartender who poured me the perfect Stone Smoked Porter - everyone had a smile. We will come back for sure - maybe for that one week vacation! Thanks Pearl People!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan P
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, young, hip, chic! Very friendly front desk and awesome staff. Shout out to Charrah! Stayed here for 2 nights. It was close to everything, Sea World, Mission Beach, Pacific Beach and all the great local restaurants. Room was cute and cozy. Was there for drive-in Wed. Will definitely stay again!! THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “one dark night in san diego”
Reviews.Author: sussan_au
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights after being upgraded to a better room that didnt smell we were a little bit happier. We experienced the good food in the restaurant and enjoyed the movie night by the pool. The staff were very friendly and willing to assist us in our needs. All though through no fault of the hotel we did experience a dark night in San Diego because all power was lost for about 12hrs. Overall our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A truly unique way to stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: kwarden360
Reviews.Content: The Pearl really captures what I feel is the goal of a boutique hotel. It provides an unique experience to the guest completely different from the cookie-cutter corp hotels. Rooms are sleek, comfortable and interesting. (each room has its own "sea life" (fish) with name plate). Service is fantastic and it is obvious that the creators of this hotel have a passion for design. Looks as if every detail had been thought about when creating the guest space. Still can't believe how good the food is in the restaurant, especially for a hotel this size. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Get-A-Way in Point Loma”
Reviews.Author: Jerry C
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and quaint hotel with tremendous atmosphere and service! The bar and restaurant are especially good. Their "Dive-In" movie nights at their heated pool are a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great service here!”
Reviews.Author: oblos
Reviews.Content: The place is safe although you need a car to get to the center. The rooms are OK but the service is awesome and there is a really good vibe around the place.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! Love everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: Katie T
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and helpful staff. Love the hotel decor, atmosphere and overall vibe of the entire place :) Awesome restaurant/bar too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Pearl for a wedding. The staff was amazing! They made us feel welcome and took care of every need. A great get away!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gerintell
Reviews.Content: I have been looking forward to staying at the Pearl now for quite some time, and last weekend I finally got in after seemingly months of them being booked solid (summer in San Diego.) After finally staying, it more than lived up to the hype! I stayed in two rooms during my stay: the gem and the jewel. The first night was the gem, and it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in... however it was also one of the best for it's price (even compared to rooms three times it's size at other hotels!) I was easily able to plug my laptop into the HDMI port of the 42 inch tv mounted near the wall, and then sit on the bed and control some of the movies I have prepared for my evening. The bed itself was also VERY comfortable, and featured a very lightweight summer comforter sandwiched between two clean and very soft (high thread count I imagine) sheets. The second nights stay was in the Jewel. The jewel was much larger and had a larger bed as well. The bed was the exact same make it seems so it was also very comfortable, and there was again a large HD television (panasonic) in the room for me to plug my computer into easily via an HDMI port. Also in both rooms were two wonderful little beta fish (one per room) which me and my girlfriend found quite amusing (I've never seen fish in a hotel room before!) All in all, I would steer clear of the gem if you are claustrophobic or dislike small spaces, but if you're anything like me, and love cozy little places that are well furnished and VERY practical, then you will love the "bachelor pad" that is the gem. I have never stayed in the pearl's largest room as they were sold out both nights, but I can bet they are very nice! All in all, if you're looking for a luxurious get away, the pearl is not for you, but if you have an interest in something different you just might love it. The staff was also extremely friendly and helpful - some of the best i've ever experienced even compared to the nearby resorts. You also should dine in the evening if you are interested in some different and VERY tasty food, or simply get a drink at their bar (which is buzzing with activity on the weekends!) where they will make you whatever you wish exactly how you like it!

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place!”
Reviews.Author: SerenityJewel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay so much! We are going back for our Anniversary in October!

Reviews.Title: “nice and trendy”
Reviews.Author: meiered
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights and had a very nice stay. The rooms are very modern, clean and with a comfortable bed and a huge TV screen on the wall. The food in the restaurant is excellent. Kim was very flexbile and helpful. For a short stay definetly a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, charming and chic”
Reviews.Author: Got_root
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to San Diego for business and The Pearl came highly recommended. I must say I was not disappointed. The atmosphere is certainly unique in an upscale retro chic kind of way, yet at the same time warm and inviting. From the moment I arrived Kimberly made me feel like I was just staying a couple days with friends. Outside you’d almost miss it, once inside you’ll find yourself transported to a tropical oasis. The use of space is wide and open with the bar, restaurant, pool and lounge blending together making a unique place relax and engage in good conversation. The staff was cordial, helpful, attentive and friendly. In the middle of the week the lounge was obviously the place to go for those in the know! I just loved the old ‘surf flicks’ projected on the giant screen towering over the pool. Each week a blockbuster movie is featured at their ‘Dive-In Theater’ too. The rooms feel large and make smart use of space. They’re comfortable with flat screen TV’s and tons of channels, comfortable beds and even a fish to keep you company. Kitschy, hip, retro and cool…if you are looking for something fun with great energy The Pearl won’t disappoint you either!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Somplsmom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Pearl and it was a great hotel, location was great and we were able to walk quite a few places. The hotel was very clean and can't beat the H20+ body products!

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem, fun bar, staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: ScubaChickJamie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and had a nice stay. We ate dinner at the bar and the food was wonderful. But the most important aspect of our trip was when I ran into some logistically challenging travel plans and needed help. Kimberly was on it right away. She solved our problems, helped us and got us on our way. She was terrific. The bar can be loud at times but shuts down at 11 pm. Fun, clean, comfortable boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unique place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JTraver27
Reviews.Content: We had a short, two night stay at The Pearl. We had a room right next to the pool area, which was great during the day, however at night, the location of our room was not ideal for an early bed time. We had traveled from the East Coast and weren't feeling like we were on the West Coast time yet and there were several very loud visitors in the pool/lounge area. One of them mistakenly walked to our room door and was trying to get in (thinking it was his room-after what sounded like he had too much to drink--while we were trying to get to sleep). One thing I would recommend for a change in the rooms would be to add more counter space in the bathroom. There was a smal ledge, but it didn't leave a lot of space for a straightener/curling iron or makeup. We did enjoy that the hotel offered towels with the hotel name on them for guests to "buy" if they wanted. Cute momento. The hotel was in a nice location for running along the water.

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is great fun”
Reviews.Author: hamilton93
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, i felt like Austin Powers would show up any second. Bar is top notch with a varied crowd. Monday night bar and restaurant were still half full at 9:45pm, Goldfinger was playing over the pool, bartender was awesome. Room was clean, fun furnishing. Felix the red fighting fish was my roommate for the evening. Bed was comfortable and i had a great nights sleep. Bathroom was the only aged part of the room, slight miss, but shower was hot and strong. Fun location, great little hotel, you can run in the morning around the harbor. Staff was fantastic. Come on a wednesday for Movie Night by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Modern at It's Best!”
Reviews.Author: photoluxxe
Reviews.Content: I love everything about The Pearl Hotel and Restaurant! I booked the Essentials package, that came with free parking for your stay, two complimentary cocktails, and one appetizer. I stayed in Room 3 and everything was great! The bed was super comfortable and I had a wonderful nights sleep. The room comes with a small patio area, which in my opinion is just ok. I think it could be a little bigger and more private, but if your not going to use it then it shouldn't be a big deal to you. At the Restaurant, the bartender was awesome! He knows what he's doing and is willing to help you out. A+ for the serivce he gave. I think his name might of been John?? Don't quote me on that though! lol The ONLY things that I think could be improved would be the bathroom, carpeting, and mosquito problem. The carpeting in the room was almost rope like in feeling so I wore sandals when I walked around. The bathroom was not disgusting but it did look run down. There was also this strange occurance of several small mosquitos I caught flying in the room. I think they might be coming from the plants. Those problems are small and the rest of the experience was so great , I was able to overlook the little things. Don't get me wrong, I am super picky when it comes to hotels! I highly reccommend staying here. For people who are constant complainers (you know who you are) don't stay here if you want a nice quiet getaway, there is a Hilton down the way for you.

Reviews.Title: “Sheek, with a good atmosphere, but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: pjmac123
Reviews.Content: The pearl hotel is a trendy hotel. It has a trendy bar and restaurant which is frequented by the locals (except when it's closed on a Sunday) and the look and feel of the place is very modern with tasteful decor and funky furniture. There was a little hic-up at the beginning of our stay when we were given the wrong room. However the hotel made up for this by giving us vouchers for the restaurant and some free drinks and got us in the right room for the rest of our stay. I have to say though, the staff did seem a little confused and overwhelmed at times and organization was not the best. The rooms themselves were nice. We had a pet fish which was a nice touch. We missed having a fridge though, and there wasn't much storage space for clothes etc. I can't help but get the feeling that they decided to spent the money on the look of the place rather than on the extra room provisions that would have made our stay a little more comfortable. They run a film night by the pool/bar which was a neat idea, except that we couldn't hear the film, so that kind of ruined that. Shame. You'd be better off going out for a nice meal/drink and going to the cinema afterwards! Overall though, our stay was pleasant enough, location was good, although you need a car (free parking available!) as a taxi to the gas-lamp quarter will set you back $25 each way. The gas-lamp quarter is the place to go for food/drinks. Good atmosphere and plenty to choose from. If you can fly to/from San Diego rather than LA then do it as the airport if literally 5 minutes from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique and Enjoyable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Garethmb
Reviews.Content: When visiting scenic San Diego, travelers can do themselves a favor and stay at one of the more unique and charismatic hotels in the area. The Pearl is truly a textbook example of not judging a book by its cover. The unassuming exterior of the hotel conveys that the building was once an apartment complex as it sits quietly on the corner of a residential neighborhood. Upon walking a path from the parking lot to the lobby, I noted that the courtyard of the hotel is taken up by pool and patio and had a very lively party underway in the middle of the afternoon. The lobby is essentially a small check in station to make more room for a cozy lounge opposite the bar and restaurant on the other end of the room. The lobby lounge area is essentially a collection of carpeted nooks with pillows and all manner of classic games such as Rock-em Sock-em Robot where guests could entertain themselves while they enjoyed a drink. Upon checking into our room we were delighted to find a very comfortable room decorated in an artfully retro and unique style. The vintage Art Deco theme works very well and I found the inclusion of our own beta fish to be a nice touch. I learned that each of The Pearl rooms come equipped with its own beta, each with their own introductary name plate. For our stay, Willie contently swam in his bowl offering a homey charm. The bed was extremely comfortable and the high-def flatscreen television offered several channels for viewing enjoyment. The room made great use of space and offered plenty of storage for extended stays, as well as a couch and table and all the usual amenities. The bathroom was full-size which gave me the understanding that at some point in its past our room had been a studio apartment. The platform bed was extremely comfortable and with a strong AC system, my wife and I slept very soundly during our stay. As active as the social scene was at the pool it was amazingly quiet in the room even with parties going on. I learned that The Pearl prides itself on being a very active hotel that appeals to energetic adults. This became very clear later in the evening when the hotel started showing its poolside movie. In keeping with the cool Rat Pack-era vibe and motif of the hotel, we watched classic episodes of Get Smart from the bar. While more modern films are shown it is nice to see that the hotel isn’t afraid to mix things up now and then and having the option to either watch a movie from the poolside or from the bar overlooking the pool just emphasized the laidback and relaxed ambience. The cocktails offered by the bar were highly enjoyable and while we did not get a chance to enjoy the restaurant during our visit I noticed the extremely impressive menu and that the dining options has been cited for excellence in several publications. The hotel is located near Shelter Island in downtown San Diego and offers unique and value accommodations for travelers. There are several restaurants and convenience stores all within walking distance of the hotel should you choose not to dine on-site. This is good as parking is a bit limited at the hotel but the very friendly and helpful staff does have spots marked off by cones which can be accessed upon check-in. One does not normally find as comfortable a room in a friendly and energetic place when traveling, especially amongst the higher priced, more sedate hotels. It was refreshing to find such a unique place and friendly staff doing things their way instead of being a cookie-cutter of the larger chain hotels which often dominate the travelers options. The Pearl was a very unique and enjoyable experience punctuated by a friendly staff that went out of their way to ensure that the guests have a good time. Larger hotels can definitely take a lesson from these folks as they are clearly doing something right and I encourage you to check out The Pearl during your next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting but fun”
Reviews.Author: Caseyg2011
Reviews.Content: Well we booked a room here since my gf likes boutique hotels and laid back atmosphere they usually provide. This hotel was not in the area we thought it was in, actually it was pretty far from what we expected. As it turns out that was a good thing. We weren't to far from Ocean Beach which is a fun experience in itself, and not to far from Pacific beach as well. They provide free beach crusier rentals and we had fun taking those out to get around quicker. Now the Hotel itself is in a somewhat run down area, and there isn't anything to see unless you bike for 30 minutes but we had an adventure because of it. Downstairs as all the other review say is fun. You can play board games get a drink and hang with a mixed crowd of people while enjoying a seat by the pool. The room is average, maybe a little below. It was clean (other than stain on sheet) and for the age it was descent. But we need to point out that the age does make a difference. The bathroom is dated, and the basic feel is a converted Motel 6 into a retro style hotel. But then again we didn't stay in the room long so those facts didn't bother me. The staff was friendly and very personable which makes up for the hotels state of disaray. I would recommend this hotel if you are open minded, enjoy people and music, and like the out of the box experience that you can't have at a huge hotel. Go have an adventure, get a bike and cruise to Ocean Beach.. just doing that makes the day rememberable.. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel expirence, ever.”
Reviews.Author: PaulinaHC
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about our stay at The Pearl. My husband and I traveled to San Diego from Las Vegas for a quick anniversary get away. I've had a number of bad hotels. This was a huge leap of faith for me and I couldn't be happier with the decision to stay at The Pearl. From the moment we arrived, the service was top notch. The front desk was very helpful in working through some credit card issues, let us check in over 2 hours early and were just as friendly as could be. There was Sunday brunch going on and I wished we hadn't eaten breakfast. Everyone out in the pool/bar area looked like they were having so much fun! I was so pleased with the room. It was so, so cute. We had a great night sleep on the comfy bed as well. We really enjoyed having after dinner drinks back at the hotel. Johnathan (the bar manager, I think) was so nice to sit down and talk to us about the history of The Pearl. He also was helpful with information on things to do in the area and great surfing spots. We also found Megan, Christina and Erica to be helpful and just really "cool." Though it is obvious the hotel is aged and doesn't offer all the amenities other larger hotels do, it wasn't even an issue to us. For the price, location, and ambiance, I don't think anything else would compare.

Reviews.Title: “Already booking our next stay!”
Reviews.Author: Janine32655
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Got to the pool before the bar/lounge opened, but they told me a liquor store nearby where we could grab some supplies and bring to the pool. The rooms are very stylish and techy, beds are super comfortable too. They screen movies on Wednesdays at the pool too! We are already booking our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Ivgi
Reviews.Content: I arrived to San Diego on Sunday, a worm sun welcomed me, it was a very good start, took a cab and after about 5 minutes the driver informed me we arrived, although we had a short drive I already saw the beauty of this city, the beautiful houses, the lovely sea, and the impressive marina. But all that was just the aperitif for a very pleasant surprise, we parked near a very small hotel, far from downtown, not impressive from the outside, after you put first step at the front door you start feel the special atmosphere that this hotel has to offer, very warm and wrapping décor, on your right a nice bar, on your left a small reception with a smiling receptionist , but before I will talk about the people, few more things about the hotel, it build in a square shape when in the middle a small pool with comfortable sitting places. The owner created a wonderful place with great atmosphere. Few evening every week, people are gathering around the pool, on a big screen you can see an old movie, laughing, some dancing, drink, great food and lovely people.. Let’s talk about people, the personnel were great, very welcoming, helping in need, and even play there part in directing a tourist like me. I am talking about everyone I met there but still I “bump” with some more occasionally.( and I hope I spell each the name correctly Marcella, the night worker who woke me up every morning, and welcomed me for a coffee at the lobby Jami, The bartender who was very nice, welcome and patient with all my questions Emily, that made us the best Mojito ever Thank you all for a wonderful hosting, hope to see you again IVGI

Reviews.Title: “all the right stuff”
Reviews.Author: JMo9
Reviews.Content: When I travel I don't need a lot of frills, but I am willing to pay for the few things I do want. I tend to veer towards boutique hotels because of the more intimate experience. When coming in from out of town, not knowing anyone, it makes such a difference when there's an approachable, friendly staff to chat around with and dig up local knowledge. I like well-designed spots, but admittedly, I shy away from hip, trendy hotels because too frequently the staff is stocked with snotty youngsters with attitudes. Right upon entering the Pearl I was greeted by the friendly front desk manager and given a little tour of the various areas of the hotel. Not only did the manager seem cool, I sensed right away she was very concerned about the quality of my stay not just at the hotel but in San Diego in general. On my second day she actually came up to me at the bar and gave me a heads up that a group celebrating a birthday booked a room next to mine. Anticipating they might get rowdy that night, she asked me in advance to let her know if I felt bothered. I really appreciated how she looked out for me- that simple gesture made me feel like a special VIP (and also probably prevented a negative review in Tripadvisor!) I liked how the bar, restaurant, pool, lounge were all integrated in the same area. This created a nice mixture of locals and hotel guests, everyone casually hanging out doing different things- eating, swimming, chatting, lounging. It wasn't a party scene, but definitely relaxed and lively on both weekend nights. I usually don't spend much time in rooms, but the rooms had a contemporary, simple, and beachy feel- not overdone. I was pleasantly surprised to find beds similar to those in a high price hotel. I slept so soundly.. The location to the airport was quick and easy. I had a free afternoon and borrowed one of the hotel beach cruisers (free!) and explored the Pt. Loma penninsula, Sunset Cliffs, as well as Ocean Beach community- it turned into a most memorable day of SoCAL sunshine and the beautiful ocean! Definitely a not-to-miss experience. Overall, The Pearl has an easy California vibe and great energy. I think you'd be hard pressed to find service at this high level with a price point at this low level.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: time4tea2011
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. We ate dinner there and the food was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaJ619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Pearl and had an awesome time! We were a little hesitant to stay here after all of the mixed reviews we had read. But, we decided to give it a go! Pulling up to The Pearl we werel a little nervous (it's located on a very busy street) but once we got inside we fell in love with all of the decor. It has a vintage feel with a modern twist. We really enjoyed the beta fish in the room, it was a nice touch! I would definetely stay here again next time im in town. Last but not least the staff was great. Really seems like they enjoy where they work!

Reviews.Title: “Reluctant to say I love it so it stays a secret”
Reviews.Author: Fozmonster
Reviews.Content: Very hip, great bar and food. Ruins surround bar so be prepared for some noise.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could use a spruce up”
Reviews.Author: squishy_9
Reviews.Content: While the converted motor inn was probably a cute idea when it opened, this hotel could use a bit of a spruce up as it's getting a little tired. Its also about a $20 can ride to downtown San Diego, which was a little further out than I was expecting. Overall this was a satisfactory hotel but I'm sure there are better deals out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Pip79_10
Reviews.Content: This is a very delayed review as it was 6 months ago this week that we stayed at the Pearl Hotel. I’ve never felt the urge to write a review of a hotel before, but I really wanted to for this hotel as I was so pleased we found this little gem & wanted to share our experience with others thinking of staying here. 7 of us Brits (age ranges between 30 & 62) arrived at the Pearl late on a Sunday night in November 2010 after driving from Las Vegas. The service we received at check in was great, we were advised on where to park our car (if you park on the street round the corner, its free as opposed to paying for parking outside) & were shown to our rooms. It was nearly midnight when we got our luggage out of the car & into our room when we discovered a (very minor) issue with our room. We weren’t going to mention it to reception but thought we would bring it to their attention. Without going into lots of detail (as it would be boring!), we received the best service over our 4 day stay we have ever had on our many trips to the US from this hotel. The reception staff were fantastic in helping to resolve our problem & they went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay at the Pearl. You can tell this isn’t a chain restaurant & is a family run hotel as the little touches made a big difference to our stay. For example, they leave a note after cleaning your room each day telling you what the next day’s weather will be & the menu for that evening’s dinner at the restaurant. We were very fortunate to be offered a free meal at the hotel, to be totally honest we were hesitant at eating in the restaurant as we like to explore the local area rather than eat at our hotel for dinner. We were very pleasantly pleased at how yummy the food was, both my husband & I had the burger & loved it – they aren’t lying when they claim it to be the best burger in the area! We were only disappointed that we left it till our last night to eat there as we would have had more food there had we ate there earlier. We ate in the outside little garden terrace & although it was a chilly November night, it has several garden heaters that made it a nice cosy area to eat & drink in. Before we headed out for the evenings, we had a few drinks in the bar – the beer drinkers in our party were impressed at the wide array of lagers & ales on offer. I had a lavender cocktail that I remember being very tasty indeed. There is a good seating area around the pool / cinema screen to enjoy drinks from the bar. With regards to the room, each one has its own fish tank on the wall which is something I’d never seen before in a hotel & I loved this detail. Between us we had 4 rooms so I got to see all rooms & all were of good standard. The location is pretty good, we drove to SeaWorld, San Diego Zoo & Old Town – none of which took that long to get to. For the evenings that we went out into San Diego, the hotel rang up for a taxi & it didn’t take long to reach our destination. Overall, I would rate this hotel very highly & if you are thinking about booking this hotel – I recommend that you do as you won’t regret it. 6 months on, all 7 of us who went on the trip adored this hotel & we still talk about our stay there – it was a real highlight of our 2 week stay to Las Vegas, San Diego, Anaheim & LA. If we ever go back to San Diego, I will make sure we stay at this hotel & if anyone who works at the hotel is reading this – thank you very much for the fabulous service!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems and bring your earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: JimKingsBeach
Reviews.Content: This is a 60's Motel which has been partially upgraded. It is right next to a very busy street. There is a good restaurant which encroahes on the small pool area. That and the bar is the focus of their buisness. You can hear everything in the room, traffic and bar noise. The pictures on the web site are totally deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Kitchy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: The Pearl Hotel is a very cute, kitchy hotel. It's close to downtown and shelter island and on a great bus line that provides easy access to the rest of the city. The only thing that would make us reconsider staying here is the noise, its quite loud with the cars traveling by on the street and with the restaurant location in the hotel courtyard. We were in a room that was tucked behind a wall, yet it was very loud. That didn't detract too much from our stay, but should be a consideration for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely,kooky kinda hotel in nice part of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MHort1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel (recommended as it was by Tripadvisor) very late in the evening after a long drive from Death Valley & the night staff were very helpful & no-fuss. Room was lovely and totally different to any of the other 7 or 8 places we'd stayed in on our trip to the SW US. The ambience at the hotel screams chill-out & there's lots of nice touches here & there (we had a goldfish bowl hanging on the wall in our room which housed Stanley the Goldfish-that's a definite first for me!),the LCD TV was great,the bed & bed linen was very nice,lowdown & comfy,the bathroom was nice.The venetian blinds on the windows was a nice touch until morning came & we realised it was well-nigh impossible to get some light into the room without passers-by on the walkway outside being able to peer in. Other than that,staff were very friendly & parking (despite the fact it looked like it would be impossible to get everybody's car on the lot) was fine. Lovely part of town too with the harbour just down the road & downtown not far away. Definitely recommend for something a bit out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great eats, fun atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: traskie
Reviews.Content: Great central location in between down town and the beaches. Loved the rooms, comfy beds (and sheets, I usually bring my own sheets and didn't, and was pleasantly surprised)... the food was great and I loved the whole atmosphere (and they played one of my all time favorite movies on the dive-in screen) - Killer and unique specialty drinks, a definite thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Funky little 60's styled hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shelleymidnight
Reviews.Content: Found this little gem (a pearl in fact!) using Trip Advisor's rating - I almost went with Quality Inn around the University as it was highly rated in same price range - but so glad I stayed here instead - I arrived on Wednesday night which was "Dive-in" Theatre - outdoor movie played above the swimming pool. Food was great - try the Happy Hour for great prices - room was clean, retro-styled, and functional, and I liked the location - Point Loma area. Little ways from the downtown for taking a taxi, otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property Extremely Lacking in Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: anniebananie719
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel for his birthday for one night. For such a beautiful lobby/restaurant and modern room, we were unexpectedly disappointed by the customer service. We arrived a little early to check the place out and to inquire about early check in. Upon arrival, we were not greeted or acknowledged and when we asked WHERE check in was the girl at the desk abruptly said it wasn't until 3. It was approx. 1:30 pm. We didn't even have a chance to inquire about early check in. We came back after lunch and the same girl checked us in. There were no pleasantries of welcoming us to the hotel. The room was nice - modern with a beachy feel. The platform bed was comfortable, the bathroom was old, but renovated to look modern, the carpet was clean, and all the essentials were present (shampoo/conditioner, soap, lotion, and blowdryer). The lighting, however, was very dim with all the lights on and the heater/air very noisy. Overall, it was a comfortable room. And the fish was a unique touch. The other reviews were accurate about the noise level. It seemed like a popular place for people to hang out, even right outside our 1st floor room. We didn't mind since we were extremely tired from our morning of kayaking. Upon our check out, the same girl was at the desk. She didn't ask us how our stay was and did not thank us for our stay. I think I even thanked her without a response. Not only did we not receive a welcoming vibe from her, but also the other employees both at check in and check out. We appreciated the emails before and after our stay and our welcome postcard in our room, but those were the only things that showed us the staff cared. We would have rather received the same attention in person. The Pearl is a beautiful property and close to many restaurants, essentials, and attractions but I would not recommend the hotel to friends simply because of the hotel staff's lack of customer service. Customer service is extremely important in the hotel industry, especially in Las Vegas where I work, so I may be more critical than others. However, a smile, a hello, and a thank you (which we did not receive from ANYONE) go a long way! My comments may not make a difference in how things are done, but I hope at least one person will take them to heart.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks”
Reviews.Author: quantumhotspot01
Reviews.Content: The placed looked like a Cheap motel that was converted into a nicer motel. It's definitely not a hotel. The worse thing about it was I was in room 21 and there was this vibration coming from somewhere that literarly vibrated the whole room to the point of nausea. I called to ask about the noise and if it would stop but they said its the kitchen and it should shut off by after 10pm. It shut off for about 30 minutes then went on again and I asked to be moved to another quieter room and they told me there was nothing they could do. Two days of this sickness vibration I thought I was going to puke. Worse place I've stayed by far. Rather sleep in my car then stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Another Flawless Sojourn at the Fantastic Pearl”
Reviews.Author: PazosArmando
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed another wonderful stay of two weeks. Fantastic meals courtesy of Chef Aaron Lamot and the great kitchen staff consisting of Marty, Cale and Chris (Nugget). Exceptional service in the Bar/Restaurant from Jamie, Emily, Chloe, Lindsay, Vanh and John. As always, exceptional attention to all my day to day request from the front desk staff, especially Adele, Erika and the unmatched morning musings of Marcella. Thanks to the entire staff for making my time there truly feel like my "home away from home".

Reviews.Title: “Hotel manager negative for the company, too bad because I liked the food”
Reviews.Author: Blanca60750
Reviews.Content: I've always been curious on how a place gets raved reviews, but manages to dis-satisfy customers so badly. Cleanliness does not hold up to the standards that you would expect from a normal hotel. On the surface looks good, but if you look at the details it’s so gross. The rooms are so small that you can't miss it. I don't even think they have cleaning staff on site because the hostess seemed like she was responsible of the front desk, part of the restaurant, and any room service issues. No offense to the youth, but it's not fair for them to be the face of the whole place. When management stepped in - the image of this place was doomed. She was rude and unprofessional. Was not genuine at all, defensive and didn't seem to be happy that day. Food was good, drinks were expensive. If you are next to a liquor store, a place should not charge downtown prices. Its marketed to be a laid back spot, but my experience didn't reflect that, Will never go back or recommend it, but dang I liked the food and the bar staff was welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “The best San Diego motel - Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: nhkiwi
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit here - it's so close to the airport and we really love the groovy atmosphere of the motel. The rooms are always clean and this was the first time we had room service from their restaurant. The food was unbelievably good. Some of the best I've ever had - we will definitely be back (and be eating!) there. Our new favourite motel!

Reviews.Title: “delightful staff.”
Reviews.Author: edina26
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was genuinely helpful. Loved the location, very convenient to airport and downtown. Amazing restaurant at the hotel. Food and service could not have been better. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, bad location but WONDERFUL people”
Reviews.Author: emmydot
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we were greeted by EXTREMELY friendly front desk service (Jessica, I think). She definitely went above and beyond to make sure we were set for our stay in San Diego, got directions for us off of the internet, and recommended different places for us to go. However, after checking in, we had to take a "back way" up to our room which was so cluttered with random tools, plants, and other housekeeping supplies that we were almost unable to get our bags up to the room. At least twice, we saw staff and nobody offered to help us or to move things out of our way. When we got to the room, it was very cute and complete with a little beta fish. It was however, VERY dirty and dusty. I was able to see nail files, hair, and other dirt beneath the wooden bed frame and there was also quite a bit of dirt all along the banisters around the entire room. Straw that broke the camel's back was that there appeared to be a "stain" on our sheets. On the plus side, the restaurant and bar was AMAZING with some really great food and only local beer on tap. And again, I can't stress how wonderful the staff was. We did, however, decide to switch hotels, due mostly to the location. Staff was still very helpful when we told them that we were switching hotels. I guess this place just wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sjpc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Pearl Hotel. We were looking for an inexpensive hotel prior to heading north to LA. The area surrounding the Pearl Hotel appeared a bit run down, so I was surprised when I walked into the lobby. The lobby's decor was contemporary and chic. It had a cool bar and a nice lounge area. They offer dinner, which was served near the bar and near the pool (while showing a movie). I was surprised how many people showed up in the evening for dinner (we did not eat there). The room was clean and chic, but sparse. The bed was comfortable. It was incredibly quiet. However, by the condition of the bathroom, it was evident this was once a low quality motel: outdated bathroom fixtures, black stained tiles. Considering the reasonable price, other than the condition of the bathroom, I thought the hotel was good otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Nest with a View”
Reviews.Author: FootWhisperer
Reviews.Content: The Pearl's been really good to me everytime I've stayed! I'm delighted to recommend it's simple yet groovy vibe, the mix and mingle of the hip and social crowd, the lively mood and feel of the poolside big movie screen enternmt... I could go on & on. We're definitely looking forward to having our next party poolside!

Reviews.Title: “Mid Century Dreamland aka The Pearl”
Reviews.Author: sugar51
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed and celebrated my birthday here. Service, decor, food, and ambiance were all on point. I made reservations online, which was easy and quick. Received speedy confirmation. Check in was with the delightful and stylish Adele. She also took care of my dinner reservations, which originally was for a party of 6. As the night progressed and my dinner companions grew ( about 20 more folks ), Adele and the rest of the staff at The Pearl were fantastic. Accommodating with extra seating and even reserved a lounge area for Bingo night! I had a fun and memorable birthday thanks to The Pearl. I stayed in the Gem, which is a cozy little room w/ mirrored ceiling and great decor. I have also stayed in the larger rooms w/ patio, which are excellent as well.
