BTW, the bar closed at midnight or eleven on the night we were there, so it wasn't too bad...it was quiet enough after that to sleep in until 10am without any problems. PS--parking costs, but you can find street parking for free right by the hotel (not easy to find, but was safe once we got it)

Reviews.Title: “If you want chic fun with a sassy and classy vibe - the Pearl is for you!”
Reviews.Author: csusmchic
Reviews.Content: We are locals from San Diego, but had four days until we moved out of state. We had had dinner and drinks at the Pearl several times and decided we would stay there for four nights. GREAT DECISION!!! The rooms is great - very clean and airy, ours even had a nice little patio to sit outside with drinks. Our fish (every room gets one) was named Jaws - we will miss him =) The staff is awesome, the bartenders are very easy going and the food is yummy! We walked to a restaurant in the area on one night and drove downtown another night. Overall, would recommend this to any young, hip couple that doesnt mind music at night and chic digs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Find”
Reviews.Author: debs020764
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. we found it, checked out the review and booked it. From check in to check out (and at all points inbetween) the staff couldnt have been more genuinely helpful or nice - owner, manager, bar staff, check in person etc. Plus the rooms were great, the scene around the bar and the pool a perfect mix between super relaxed and funky. and amazing food. Location good - easy to get everywhere. Not for kids or for adults seeking zen like peace and quiet, but perfect for adults wanting a getaway at somewhere where nobody cares if you're lying down in the bar on cushions reading the paper and drinking the free coffee. . We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hip with many serious misses - VERY NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDuo6
Reviews.Content: We travel a great deal and took a chance that the website was true but it turns out that all the reviews who complained about the noise are true. We thought "how bad can it be for one night?" Unless you are here to enjoy the very loud and rowdy pool/bar scene, this is NOT the place for you. The check in staff was nice, the room is small and hip but smelled odd like dirty carpet/musty. The bar is fun, better if you are not a hotel guest, and the happy hour is great. Deserts were not great and don't order an Irish Coffee unless you want a cup of coffee with whiskey poured in! The place was VERY noisy until midnight from the bar and because every room is on the street, the noise from Rosecrans is loud all night long. And, when we finally did fall asleep, we were awakened in the morning by very loud and noisy housekeeping staff talking and laughing outside our door. They do have parking for $10 per night and it is worth it as parking is impossible in the neighborhood. And, if you leave they will save your spot in the front lot for you. The best part about our stay was walking to Pomodoro's for dinner. It is a few blocks down and had wonderful service and GREAT italian food. So, our suggestion is to believe what everyone says about the noise and the smell in the rooms, find a different place to stay and have dinner at Pomodoro's!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great San Deigo Vibe”
Reviews.Author: funmum22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I found this hotel from the website and we could not have enjoyed our stay more! The Pearl is a gem! First of all i loved the way the name is written on the outside of the hotel. The place is small, but whomever was the designer was excellent at making every corner of space exude retro coolness. The room was standard size, but had a great bed, tv and radio. They all worked. The lounge, bar seemed really spacious due to the floor to ceiling windows which looked out at the pool. The pool was right outside the bar which had a movie screen above it and huge blowup transparent balls in it that floated around, cool. Was a little jet lagged so i took a nap, and then dinner. We got to the bar right before the end of happy hour, so we had a cocktail, made efficiently and tasty by the bartender. Noticed that many local people were at the restaurant, always a good sign. We ordered dinner, YUM! We appreciate a place that has a chef, i practically licked the plate, nice sauce. We ordered a $25 bottle of wine, also very yummy, and a great value. We received personal attention at every level of our experience here. Again, the bed was great. I had a restful night sleep. The morning coffee you guys, was fabulous!! Nothing says good morning like a nice cup of java. ahh. I would stay here again, and look forward to it! Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “A Little Slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: FLNgoodISgoodENUF
Reviews.Content: "DOWN TO EARTH, UP WITH STYLE" About a month ago, my boyfriend and I headed down to San Diego so I could introduce him to my dad (and my stepmom, and my older sister, and my little sister, and my little brother, AND the two dogs, aaaand the turtle). Eesh! With what promised to be an interesting and possibly overwhelming weekend ahead of us, the last thing we wanted to deal with was the hassle of finding the right hotel at the right price. Enter The Pearl... DRUMROLL PLEASE...I absolutely LOVE this place! I called on a Thursday and was able to book a room immediately for the following two nights. The person I spoke with over the phone was amazing. His name's Tom and was so friendly and incredibly helpful. There are three types of rooms available, The Gem, The Jewel, and The Strand. We booked one of The Jewels for $109 a night, which was a surprising $20 CHEAPER than if you booked the same room through http://Expedia.com. When I got off the phone with Tom, I was so excited for the weekend I could hardly sleep that night. When we got into San Diego (Point Loma, to be precise), we headed down Rosecrans to find The Pearl. Upon arriving, the parking situation left much to be desired. Valet parking is $10 a night and I'm not one for unnecessary expenses so we parked a couple of blocks away and hoofed it. When we entered the hotel, I was blown away by the decor. The vibe is retro-beach-glam. Is that a real thing? No? Well, I just made it up, so HA. The furniture has that sleek futuristic look that was the height of coolness in the 50s and 60s. There are plenty of candles and mirrors on the walls that work with some colored bulbs to create unique and beautiful lighting. The pool area is fun and hip, complete with a huge mounted movie screen that they call the Dive-In Theatre. They do movie nights where you can hang in the pool or on the comfy pool-side seating and catch a flick while enjoying a drink or two from the hotel bar. Our room was totally cool-- cozy and welcoming--even better than the hotel's website had led us to expect. It had a 42" flat screen TV, a king-size platform bed with soft (and CLEAN) sheets and fluffy pillows. There was ample closet space although we wouldn't need it for just the two nights, and the bathroom was spotless. The hotel provides H2O products for the standard shampoo-conditioner-lotion trio and I must say, the lotion made it's way into my purse in less than ten minutes and stayed there for weeks while I squeezed every last drop out of it. We also had our own little patio but the best part of the room? The beta fish! Every room has their own little beta fish in a bowl mounted on the wall. It was such an unexpected detail and I thought it was totally cute and original. Because it was such a short stay, we didn't have a whole lot of interaction with the staff. Upon checking out we had to wait a while as the front desk clerk was nowhere in sight but when she showed up she was really sweet and made sure we'd had a great stay. We were really busy with family stuff so we also missed out on having dinner and drinks at the hotel restaurant but we'll try that out during our next stay. All in all, we were really pleased with the experience. The room was great, the pool area made us wish it was about 20 degrees warmer, and the overall vibe was totally in sync with our own style, although I wish parking weren't such a pain in the tookus. I definitely reccomend you check it out for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Definintely Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: yelabgirl
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay here because I used to live in Point Loma and was happy to see someone had updated this hotel into what looked like a chic, modern little gem. Unfortunately it did not come close to meeting my expectations. When we checked in and got to our room - there was basically some sort of plumbing issue that had completely backed up into our sink. Yuk! - we called the front desk and they promptly came to clean it up. But that wasn't the end of it. We were promised by the website a large flat screen TV. - true, but it didn't really work. Each time I turned it on, it would immediately turn back off. I finally figured out that if I turned it on and immediately changed the channel it would stay on. But then when I turned it off, it turned itself back on. Bizarre. We were also promised wi-fi, which again - DID NOT WORK! Neither did the in-room radio system. sigh. The room was quite small and while they had tried to update the look - the remodel was done on the cheap! The rain style showers drizzled water that was either burning hot or ice cold - and again, hard to turn off and on as the nozzle turned endlessly in either direction. The room layout was OK but it was very dark and dank. And while the room was supposed to have a king size platform bed - they obviously went cheap and bought some sort of irregular sized mattress for a big discount. The platform itself was king sized, but the mattress ended more than a foot before the end of the platform. Turns out it was only 6 feet long - MUCH shorter than a King and my poor boyfriend spent the night with his feet hanging off the end! Oh yeah, and there is basically no parking available. When we complained, the staff was quite rude and unhelpful to us. The service was definitely amateurish. We didn't have any food or drinks - so if you are looking for a bar - this might be a good place to go as the bar was busy at night. BUT DO NOT STAY HERE - there are plenty of nice hotels on Shelter Island and Harbor Island, don't waste your money in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluescissors76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Pearl for our honeymoon. I read all the reviews before we went, so I was under no illusions that this would be a quiet place, a luxurious place, or a perfect hotel. We had never stayed at a non-chain, and I wanted to check it out anyway. We really enjoyed our stay. We checked in on a Monday, and not too many guests were staying on a Monday. I was prepared to ask for a room away from the pool area if necessary, but we got one without asking. (Number 17.) It was near a side street, so street noise wasn't too bad, but we had to run the AC at all times because the room got really stuffy if we did not, and the AC was very loud. Still, if you don't mind loud fans running, that doesn't seem like a big deal to me. Plenty of chain hotels are the same way. Some of the rooms are RIGHT next to the pool. I wouldn't have liked to stay in one of those rooms. A few of the reviews mentioned that there was no place for breakfast nearby. This is not true (or I guess it may be true depending on your definition of breakfast). A Starbucks and a smoothie place are about two blocks away, and there was another restaurant that appeared to be serving breakfast maybe 3-4 blocks away, although we did not check it out. It is not the most pedestrian-friendly area, but it is possible to get to these places without an automobile. Also - the restaurant does have coffee available in the mornings. They set up a coffeepot at the bar. One day the cleaning people did not clean the room while we were out, but I was able to find someone to ask about getting clean towels in the meantime, and the cleaning crew was still around, so the room was cleaned when we went out again later. The food at the restaurant was phenomenal. I had this mushroom risotto that was just wonderful, and the drinks were great too. We ended up splurging for a daily guaranteed parking spot. It was our honeymoon, after all. I think it was $25 a day. This required us to ask someone to move a cone to our spot after we left for the day, but after the first time we just did it ourselves rather than bother anyone. Street parking seemed to be relatively available, but it was still nice to have that guaranteed spot and not have to worry about it. We paid in cash, and they were not really equipped to handle payment in cash. They didn't have any change, and the bar was not open. Fortunately we didn't really need the change, so we just told them to tip the cleaning crew. All in all, it was a unique experience for a honeymoon, and I'm glad we took a chance on a new place.

Reviews.Title: “Clever Branding, Lame Motel”
Reviews.Author: knoxg
Reviews.Content: I can tolerate most hotels, this one included, for a night. Sometimes staying in cheap motels is the way to go and you don't expect the most comfortable bed. However, for a romantic getaway, when you're really thinking hard about where you want to stay and have the cash to stay in a wide variety of properties, it is a huge disappointment when even the basics aren't met by a hotel that looks like it ought to just fine. The website looks awesome. While I saw some of the negative reviews here: small rooms, noise from both the club (it's a club, ok!) and the road (wow, that is a surprisingly busy road!), what no one mentioned is that the beds are CRAZY BAD. Cheap, soft beds and crappy pillows. It is like staying in a dorm room. It was one of the worst night sleeps I've had in a long memory and certainly not the quality I was expecting. I could feel the springs in my back on the lousy mattress. Yikes! Here's what I disliked about this hotel besides the terrible, low end bedding. 1. Shower was broken. 2. Room had strange moldy smell, like bad venting from hotel and our room felt very airless quickly, even in the cool night. 3. Loud (it is, after all, just a cheap, badly constructed roadside hotel on a busy road...) and so everyone who mentioned how loud it was, I agree! Wow, it was loud! And we had the room in the far, back corner, though it seems next to some kind of generator. 4. Dying fish in room. Our little fish, colorless, lifeless and barely alive. Yikes! A gimick gone horribly wrong... 5. Burnt out light bulb in hallway: it's a small thing, but that's what sets apart a good boutique hotel from a dingy highway motel right? It was hard to see the lock on our door. Again, the expectation, based on the website was pretty high... We had one of the four deluxe rooms and I would definitely have not wanted anything smaller. It did not feel deluxe and did not match the website expectation. I'll mention the service. In a word, definitely NOT boutique service... the bartender had to look up how to make a Manhattan (which was terrible), the front desk did not know how much it would cost to take a cab to the airport, the waitress did not know if there would be coffee in the morning (there's no coffee pots in the rooms) and had to think of places to recommend... it just seemed like everyone was new and you'd think based on the extreme BRANDING and professional gloss they put on everything that traveler basics would be drilled into the staff. Finally, let me mention dinner. Slow night on a Monday, even with the Prix Fixe menu, but it still took over two hours to get our appetizer, dinner and dessert and not in that happy French cafe slow service way. Waitress was apologetic, explaining that they only had one chef in the kitchen but then they only had three tables going! If the chef can't handle three tables, boy howdy. Our dinner order was mixed up with wrong food and while they ended up comping the meal generously, it certainly wasn't how we expected to spend a good chunk of our evening in San Diego. We waited and waited and waited. Though it gave us more time to drink wine out of plastic cups since we sitting next to the pool. Oh! the indignity! The romance ruined! This hotel would likely be just fine and fun if you were there for one of the party nights, thought you'd get some action and romance, and booked a room using their after midnight love special. Maybe that would be fun. I'm not terribly pissed off at the experience since I like trying non-chain hotels and got a room for $99.00 off-season special, but it was DEFINITELY NOT the experience I was hoping for (a special end to a great holiday) and felt the website and presentation was misleading enough to post my first review on this site as a warning to others. I would definitely not stay here again. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1985
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying at The Pearl because of the bad reviews I read...but had no choice because everything else was booked. DON'T LISTEN TO THOSE BAD REVIEWS!! This hotel was beautiful, classic, different, CLEAN, hip...everything was great. The hotel is a mix between classy 60's and modern style! Loved the staff because they were so friendly and helpful. We arrived 2 hours early and they still let us check in and offered to take our bags upstairs to our room. Check-out isn't till 12:00 and let me tell you that extra hour helps. The hotel WAS NOT noisy like other reviews said...and I was there for the weekend! I love this place and will stay here every time I come to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay”
Reviews.Author: BargainGirl82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Pearl for one night and enjoyed it very much. We called early in the day to see if we could have an early check in and they told us no problem. We checked in and the guy at the front desk was super nice. I had booked the smallest room through hotels.com and because they didnt have any ready when we checked in, they upgraded us to the next biggest, which was nice. The rooms are on the smallish side, but we didnt really care about the size. The bed was nice and big and comfy and the flat screen was cool. Everything was retro-modern which was a nice change from all the generic cookie-cutter hotels out there. We stayed over a Sunday night in the winter season so it wasnt too busy and was very quiet. The only downside I would mention is the thin walls, so if you are bothered by hearing your neighbors, you probably wouldnt enjoy this hotel. I would recommend this to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “For the early-20s crowd”
Reviews.Author: 1974LA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I go to San Diego for weekend trips every so often and I love to try new (to me) places. I looked around and did a lot of research on local hotels and was really excited to snag a room here. We usually stay at bigger chains like the W, Westin or Omni, but I thought a little boutique hotel (that is in the fun Point Loma area) would be a nice change. Unfortunately it didn't quite work out as hoped. The average rates for 2-star chains (Ramada, et al) are about $150. Higher end (W, Hard Rock, Omni) are about $300. This was in the high middle, about $255 after taxes. The girl on the phone offered me a free room upgrade (from queen bed to king), which was nice of her. I also signed up for the "essentials package" (free parking plus 1 appetizer and 2 drinks at their restaurant/bar) for an additional $35. Essentials package is fine for the money - if you want the drinks and apps. Parking was nice, because the street parking is hard to come by on a weekend. Good news is there's free wireless internet. Better news is that ll of the staff are really cool, friendly and accommodating. From the check-in girl (who saved a parking spot for me in the tiny lot with her own car) to the bartender (who took good care of me, even though she was slammed with a party), they all were really sweet and ran their butts off taking care of the guests. Best part was that the food was surprisingly delicious. We had late-night snacks, desserts and drinks in our room and were THRILLED. The hotel is TINY. There's a tiny pool surrounded by tiny rooms. Our room had a king bed (quite comfy) that nearly took up the whole space. The shower was nice (love the rain showerhead), except that it was a little grimy. Could have been cleaner. It was noisy because the bar is around the pool, which is 4-feet from our door. We had to keep the blinds closed or the bar people could see right in. Weird. Luckily the air-conditioning unit was really loud (in a good way) and drowned out the people noises. We slept really well. The unfortunate part is is that the website makes it look WAY cooler than it is. It looks like a groovy mid-century hotel (like the fabu Horizon in Palm Springs) that offers a chill time. Maybe lounge around the pool and kick back with a mai tai and some fondue. Re-reading their website after the fact, they do mention a "spirited nightlife scene" and that "occasionally, the energetic buzz of good times can be heard in-room..." and that, "...care is taken to limit sound levels." Um, okay? I don't know if there's a college around there, or something, but this was basically a frat party. It's 20-somethings running a hotel and bar that caters to 20-somethings. Definitely go there if you A) want to be in Point Loma, B) like to party and be loud, C) are 21-30, D) get a rate of $160 or less, or 5) can sleep through noise. Overall a decent enough place. Just not worth the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pearl Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pearl Hotel in April 2008 for 3 nights. I prefer not to stay in chain hotels when I travel, and I especially love hotels with a modern look. The Pearl was completely affordable, and I loved the style of the hotel! I loved having a fish in my room too... so cute! I rented a car while in San Diego, so I didn't mind this location at all. I knew it wasn't going to be right on the beach. The hotel was right down the street from Trader Joe's, which was perfect for grabbing a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. There is a small parking lot for the hotel, where you can pay to park your car overnight. I just parked mine on the streets surrounding the hotel. I never had a problem finding a spot, and I always felt safe leaving it there. The noise from the pool and bar area was a little loud at night, but not enough to bother me. I'd definitely recommend the Pearl to friends, and I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Someone is stuffing the ballot box for The Pearl!”
Reviews.Author: PikePlaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked The Pearl for a weekend stay based on TripAdvisor reviews. Having stayed there this past weekend, I have to share a suspicion: I think someone has been stuffing the ballot box in favor of The Pearl. The Pearl doesn't deserve the glowing reviews that it has received -- and I suspect that they are bogus reviews aimed at pumping up this ridiculous property. The Pearl is not a boutique hotel -- it is a renovated MOTEL. It's basically a dozen rooms circling a tiny pool. The management has tried to doll the place up, but the upgrades are very meager. My room felt like a cleaned up basement. The "platform King bed" looked as though it were resting on packing pallets! The entire place screams "motel". The staff was generally courteous, but neglected to tell me that I'd pay an extra $15 for parking in the "parking lot" -- which was nothing more than a parking strip off of Rosencranz. That's "service"? In short: do not trust the hype either here or on The Pearl's website. This place is a MOTEL with pretensions at being a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find...”
Reviews.Author: abogart72
Reviews.Content: This retro vibed boutique hotel was an amazing find. However, I should say that I don't really think it's family friendly, and I'm pretty sure my 62 year old mother wouldn't want to stay there. It is super cool, hip, funky, and very, very LOUD at night. The room was fairly small, but decorated with innovative style (fish in a wall sconce). I found the bed very comfortable, my husband found it too soft. Dinner was really tasty, but as we didn't have reservations for dinner (?) we had to eat at the bar, since it was "Dive In Movie" night. This takes place on Wednesdays, and is a cool idea-showing a hip older movie on a big screen over the pool. It was PACKED. We were fine at the bar, got really fast service, and had one too many blue-cheese stuffed olive martinis. Thursday night was even louder, I think some game or karaoke was going on til about midnight. In addition, road noise was quite loud in our room as well. Staff was very helpful-Jose in particular gave us the ins and outs of San Diego. Public transportation was right across the street, and we were given maps and internet information when we asked. Overall, I would stay here again, and recommend it, but I would ask for a room further from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't stumble, to The Pearl in Point Loma!”
Reviews.Author: Mindimer
Reviews.Content: They've completely redone an old sailor's dive into a very hip, very funky little gem with a sense of humor. The rooms feature platform beds, fishbowl lighting fixtures with actual fish in them, 36-inch flat panel TV's on the wall, free-standing showers, and very comfortable and happening furnishings. They also boast a Dive-In Movie, where they show movies on a huge screen on the second floor railing over the pool. There are huge beach balls floating all over the pool and poolside service. Omigod how I wished it were later in the year and the pool was heated. It is heated later in the year, but damn the luck for coming in February. We love this place and will be coming back. For special occasions, be sure to reserve #9, The Strand, a huge room with living area, desk, and balcony. The best part? If you stumble in after midnight, you can get any unsold room for $79. Beat that. Daddy-O.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, retro little hotel”
Reviews.Author: micdenton
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at The Pearl after a concert at the House of Blues in the Gaslamp Quarter just before the holidays. Very cute! Got a midsized room - small, but very stylish. Flatscreen TV was nice. Satellite radio w/ remote was fun. Bed was comfy with lots of fluffy linens. Front desk staff was friendly and quick. Neat shag carpeted lounge area just beyond the front desk with pillows, cool retro décor and chess & checker boards. Bar & restaurant are off to the right with large windows looking out to the pool area which is decorated with retro furniture, bamboo plants and oversized beach balls in the pool. At night the pool area has great lighting and they have a large screen to play quirky movies & shows (we saw bits of Charlie Brown’s Christmas and Get Smart). Room has a bit of traffic noise and ours had a view into someone’s backyard, but we were there for the funky-cool atmosphere with which we were totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and hip little spot”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOC
Reviews.Content: I adored this place- If you are into retro/hip mid century modern establishments, this is the place for you. It is basically a two story completely renovated 60's era motel. The new owners spared no expense to give it a cool vibe. Awesome lobby bar/poolside cafe. Driftwood front desk, colorful italian bissaza tile in the showers, and great spa shampoo products. Minimal and Special is how I would describe this place- you will remember having your own named pet in your room-(A colorful beta in a glass wall sconce with a name placard. This place is fun.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel For Those Who Want To Party”
Reviews.Author: Reekas_Travels77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Pearl when we were in San Diego. It's in a great location - San Diego attractions are nearby and the airport is also very close. POSITIVES: - The staff is quite friendly and helpful. - The design and look of the hotel is very hip and cool. - You get an XBox 360 free of charge to play in your room. - The rooms all have a pet Beta fish in them which was a nice touch. - Great bar scene. NEGATIVES: - It's LOUD. The bar scene there is very popular and the rooms are nearby and you can hear everything. The music is loud and so are the voices from the bar. - You have to valet your car ($15/night) if you cannot find parking on the street. - Rooms are very small. If you are claustrophobic, do not stay here. - No room service. - If you need to check out early, let them know the night before, there may be no one a the front desk the next morning if you do not tell them you need an early check out.

Reviews.Title: “W or Ian Schrager on an intimate level.”
Reviews.Author: wadams
Reviews.Content: We are San Diegans and heard the buzz about this hotel from an architect who made a point to stay there with several other architects. So I took my wife there as a belated birthday present. If you are a design buff, especially mid-century or modern, you get it. Some people just won't get it since there are numerous run of the mill roadside franchise hotels nearby. Its a wonderfully not-overdone restoration/modernization of a late 50's or early 60's hotel, with all the best parts preserved. At the front, its not immediately obvious that its different from its more modest neighbors. The first clue that this is something different is the valet service. Next is the upscale restaurant, in of itself unusual in an under 50 room hotel. The restaurant is very open-air and resort like, with seating spilling out around the pool; and with an architecturally blended movie screen over the pool on which mid-century classics are shown during evening hours (we saw 007 Dr. No). Dinner was long and liesurely, since the surroundings were so comfortable. We just didn't want to leave - not to mention that our room was just accross the pool. The room (#9 - "The Strand") was large with a sofa seating area large enough to be its own room, a wide plasma tv, and a balcony overlooking the pool. The bed was nice and firm, the sheets and bedding clean, the bathroom facilities large, modern and luxurious (what do you call those wide ceiling showerheads and separate handheld shower nozzles?). The design throughout is mid-century modern yet warm - about the best I've seen this genre done. What also amazed me was the great number of interesting spaces and amenities packed into a hotel of this size. Lots of lounges, board games, balconies, nooks, and items of visual interest - all in earth and water tones, giving a feeling of warmth. There are even beach cruiser bicycles for guest use. The staff was very friendly and attentive (and probably saved our two year old's life). The location is close to the harbor, and central to downtown, the beaches, and San Diego attractions. About the only complaint I had was unavoidable due to its newness - i.e., the fresh paint and carpet smell. Anyway, think the Dub-U or one of those hip little South Beach hotels - at about half the price, but for my money better. But if your just looking for an adequate place to crash, without interest in an onsite restaurant, heated pool, or other little luxuries, you can stay accross the street. But if you want more, this is a great alternative to the newest downtown hotels at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - but BUGS at the Pearl!”
Reviews.Author: anieto_mv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pearl this last weekend for a one night getaway with my boyfriend. Paid $200 for The Jewel thru cheaprooms.com and am sad to say it wasn’t worth it. From the outside the Pearl looks like a 1970’s small apt complex or motel. Valet came out right away to greet us and direct us to the front desk. Will praise the staff – extremely nice and helpful. Check in was easy – would imagine it would be since its just a gal behind an office desk with a laptop. The pool area is small but looked really inviting – chilled water with lemon and fresh towels are already out by the pool. Made me wish I brought that polka dot bikini. Room was nice but a bit on the small side. PROs: Friendly-courteous staff, brand new – can smell a hint of fresh paint, bed was very comfortable, nice linens and comforter, flat screen tv, and loved our pet fish “Ace”. 10 minute drive to Old Town, Downtown/Gaslamp district. Close to the harbor. CONs: There was only one mirror (in the bathroom) would imagine that a floor length mirror would be somewhere in the room especially if the hotel is trying to appeal to a young adult scene. Hairdryers are provided but don’t really provide hot air and are quite heavy. And lastly, 3 bugs! LOL We were lying on the bed when a quite large, fat spider crawled across the headboard. I’m not one to freak out; spiders tend to be everywhere. We squashed it – no worries. A couple hours later I went into the rest room and saw what we initially thought was a 2 ½” long, black crack near the bathtub. Imagine our surprise when it started moving and we realized it was a caterpillar or another crawly like creature, which we laughed and disposed off ourselves. Later on I was blow-drying my hair when a cockroach ran behind the toilet and sink. Boyfriend took a picture of it with his cell phone and at this was pretty grossed out. We’ve stayed in various hotels together, ranging from an America’s Best Value Inn ( wouldn’t even give it half a star) to the W, Hyatt, or Marriott chain. Have never, ever seen a bug – let alone a cockroach. He called the front desk and the young lady was extremely apologetic and offered to move us – but we were already running late for our dinner reservation and told her we’ll have to stick it out. We didn’t encounter anymore creepy crawleys and mentioned the complaint again at check out. Front desk was unable to comp us on our room since it was already paid thru cheaprooms.com but comp’d us our valet ($15 value). At best I would consider the hotel a step up from a good Motel 6. For $200 it doesn’t have the in room amenities it should, bathroom also had chips in the floor tile, a long crack on the bathroom wall, and the bathtub drained really slowly. Wouldn’t stay at the hotel again unless rooms were at a $75-80 rate and managed to take care of their insect situation. Highly recommend Humphrey's By the Bay - a little pricey but food was wonderful, wished we would have considered a room at Humphrey's Inn.

HotelInfo.Name: The Pearl Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1410 Rosecrans St (at Fenelon), San Diego, CA 92106
